author: jhonatan smith gutierrez torres
title: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract
description: Cardano needs to implement the NFTs to its technology and to Smart Financial Contracts of its MARLOWE platform to be a leader in said market

assessments.note: The goal, as I understand it, is to somehow extend Marlowe so an NFT can be assigned to each contract. Insofar it is in scope, but questions remain.
It is unclear how the proposing team will add value in making NFT and smart contracts accessible on the Marlowe Playground.

The proposal is for minting a NFT for every smart contract created using Marlow, to establish ownership. This is currently possible in many ways using any proof of existing technology. A separate integration with Marlow is not an ideal solution.
I'm not convinced that minting NFTs with Cardano will be a differentiator that promotes Cardano adoption as a smart contract platform.

I have no basis to assess the capabilities of the team. However, the vagueness of the proposal itself gives me low confidence. If you can't explain clearly where you want to go, it is likely you won't arrive.

Without a detailed plan and the fact the proposers intend to hire developers, it is hard to say that they are likely to be successful. Please provide a detailed plan with budget and milestones breakdown.

The information presented lacks a detailed action plan. The burden of development is shifted as the proposer appears to manage funds. The requested amount was significantly reduced, but does not detail the work that is required to achieve success.

The proposers are planning to hire developers to implement the project. The proposal involves adding code to Marlow's backend and is likely to a complicated process. Therefore there is a high risk in implementing the project.

While the proposers are professional and enthusiastic, It seems as if they lack a technical understanding of what their proposed implementation would entail.  This makes estimating the costs of the project difficult, and it is unknown if they will find enthusiastic developers willing to work with them. I'm worried that the project would never get off the ground.

The way I understand this, the goal is to assign property rights to financial contracts created with Marlowe by means of an NFT. However, it is not specified what owning a smart contract even means. Is is the IP related to the source code or is it related to each deployment? What rights or permissions does the owner of a smart contract NFT have that others don't? Does the NFT somehow allow to control who can  or cannot use a contract?
How are these NFTs intended to be used?
Besides the fuzzy problem description the proposal does not say how the requested funds will be used and what the deliverables are.
More information required on the plan, and how it addresses the challenge. What is the point of the NFT's liked to the smart contracts? Is this to allow linking documentation?
The information provides is not sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. The proposal lacks accountability.
The process for development has not been finalized and the plan provided in the proposal seems vague. There is limited scope to audit the progress with this state of the proposal.

The 10k requested would cover the conception of the product and the hiring of developers. Since the proposers do not show a clear technical roadmap, I wonder how they can estimate the costs of the project. I suggest a smaller proposal in a future catalyst round focused on researching the use case to see if it is technically feasible and if the community sees is as a valuable addition to Marlowe.

solution: Implement the NFT generation function in the Cardano MARLOWE platform so that each Financial Smart Contract created has its respective NFT
